meanings.definition: The quality of being able to be deterred.
meanings.sent1: Her deterrability to follow rules made her a challenging student.
meanings.sent2: The deterrability of the security system prevented any break-ins.
meanings.sent3: The deterrability of the cat to chase the laser pointer was quite amusing.
meanings.sent4: His deterrability to resist temptation was like a dam holding back water.
meanings.sent5: The deterrability of the vaccine to prevent illness was remarkable.

meanings.definition: The state of being capable of being discouraged or prevented.
meanings.sent1: The deterrability of his enthusiasm by criticism was evident.
meanings.sent2: The deterrability of the weeds from growing in the garden was impressive.
meanings.sent3: The deterrability of the dog from begging for food was quite amusing.
meanings.sent4: Her deterrability to stay focused was like a ship battling strong currents.
meanings.sent5: The deterrability of the rain to ruin the picnic was unfortunate.
